p: Besides peptides, eight other known compounds were tentatively identified in the fat samples ( Table 5). The results showed that hercynine ([M+H] + at m/z 198) and 10-(β-dimethyl-aminopropionyl)phenothiazine ([M–H] − at m/z 298) were only found in the CO oleoresin. These compounds are the novel compounds identified in the fruit oil. Hercynine is the intermediate compound of ergothioneine biosynthesis in fungus (Askari and Melville, 1962). The other six organic compounds detected in the CO fat had [M–H] − ranged between m/z 226 and 493 ( Table 5), which include the derivatives of two heterocyclic amines. One of these six compounds, dodecyl hydroxyphosphinate (peak 39 of Figure 2), was a novel fatty acid derivative that was abundantly found in the fat samples. It was also one of the major compounds in the CO fat samples.
